At one extreme a station, KECA-TV, devotes
one hour of every five to Popular Music,
while one station, KFI-TV , presents none atall.
It was observed earlier that three kinds of
programs dominate Los Angeles television:
all kinds of drama, variety and popular music.
It is therefore of interest to observe the re¬
lative saturation of the individual station pro¬
gram structures with these three types of
programs:
14
